comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content:
Joined the 16th NF in the first week of January 1915; later posted to 20th Bn.

Note, SDGW incorrectly records number as 16/1579.

RIP

comment.author: 93319685@N06
comment._content: This soldier is remembered in Gateshead , see www.newmp.org.uk/detail.php?contentId=7298#listlink Ser NU 1379. He is on page 30. This is the book that is suppose to be in the Gateshead cenotaph (www.newmp.org.uk/detail.php?contentId=7295) on permanent display. However it is available to view at the Local library. He was recruited into the 16th Northumberland Fusiliers (see page 116, 16th Northumberland Fusiliers enlistment list) in B Company. See the Historical Record of the 16th Battalion by Capt C H Cooke MC published 1923. Published for private distribution by the Council of the Newcastle and Gateshead Incorporated Chamber of Commerce, the Guildhall, Newcastle upon Tyne. This is a brief record of the Battalion operations in WW1. This also contains A ROH. JIM PROJECT MEMBER OF NEWMP

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
CWGC website shows he was the son of Stephen E. P. and Eleanor Newton, of Gateshead.

In 1911 Private Newton was a Metal Merchant's Clerk, single, aged 26, living with his parents and 2 of his 5 surviving siblings at 239 Prince Consort Road, Gateshead.
